meanings.definition: A member of a race of one-eyed giants in Greek mythology.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the cyclopes lived in caves and were very strong.
meanings.sent2: The cyclopes in the myth had incredible strength due to their size and one eye.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cyclopes close their eye when they went to sleep?
meanings.sent4: The towering mountain looked like the home of a cyclopes, with its single peak dominating the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cyclopes with their single eye is etched in my mind from the ancient tales.

meanings.sent1: The cyclopes in the science fiction movie had a laser beam coming out of their eye.
meanings.sent2: I saw a strange cyclopes-like creature in my dream last night.
meanings.sent3: The cyclopes costume for Halloween only had one eye, making it unique and funny.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse at night resembled a cyclopes, its single beam of light scanning the dark sea.
meanings.sent5: The cyclopes in the video game had a special power hidden in their single eye.
